Description: Rectangular sandstone whetstone (?) gently rounded at one end,broken at the other; the upper surface is smoothly carved or worn, slightly concave lenghtways, and convex across; surface of the underside is flat and partly chipped, with retouched edges.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A
Curator's comments: The " larger and coarser whetstone, 9 inches x 2,5 inches, of a sharp grit, fine grain sandstone, worn rounded by sharpening knives on it", "found in chamber 19" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70. The number "19A" is scratched on the underside.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.78, p.185, pl.27)
